title: Permanently suspended for breaking ToS? Help me
body:
TL;DR Banned because I was hacked

Welp, Been here before complaining about a ban but this time its different. Last time I was toxic and I completely understand that and my account was permanently suspended, rightfully so. This time, apparently I broke ToS, I have no idea what I've done, although some fishy behaviour has happened without the last 24 hours.
 
As of making this post, last night my account was hacked and the hacker played with a full premade team for 3 games then presumably logged off (all after I went to bed). I found out this morning because I had a terrible nunu game so I checked my op.gg to see what my MMR went down to, and then something caught my eye, apparently, I played Ahri, Cassiopeia and Veigar with a full team of 5 none of which the account names I recognize. I immediately changed my password then contacted support then changed my password for a second time. I then played a fiora game in ranked and did terribly again. Logged off to cool off and take a break. But then I came back with a ban? 

I went to my email address associated with my account and was greeted witha message titled " Disciplinary Action from League of Legends! "

Message below
----------------------------------------------
Greetings overburn,

Actions that have been performed on your account are in violation of the League of Legends Terms of Use. You can review these terms at http://www.leagueoflegends.com/legal/termsofuse

Due to the severity of this violation, your League of Legends account has been banned until Thu Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 9001

If you have any questions, contact our Player Support team at https://support.leagueoflegends.com/home

Riot Games Player Support

----------------------------------------------

Wow, thanks riot that helps, now im getting really anxious because of the money I've spent on this game on both accounts I've owned.

Im just hoping this is a big misunderstanding because I believe im innocent and have not broken any terms of use.

Thank you for reading

Edit: Here are some screenshots

Screenshot 1: https://imgur.com/a/RxwpxfY This is the message I get when trying to login to my account

Screenshot 2: https://imgur.com/a/DPj7eYh This is of the games that I, the owner of the account did not play

replies.body:
You mentioned you ticketed support that your account was compromised? It sounds like it was probably a security ban. It's basically a permanent ban they put on the account when there is evidence of suspicious activity. Given you don't know how your login details were acquired in the first place, it's possible your account still isn't secure.

First I'd recommend changing the password to any associated email addresses as well, then I'd recommend submitting a ticket to support again. They will most likely ask you to submit an account recovery from there. Assuming a security ban is the case they will unban the account once ownership has been proven.

Im gone, I cant express how dissapointed and how betrayed I feel, I am completeley innocent and I have lost a thousand dollars worth of items. I am truly saddened. If there is anything you can do please help. This has happened to me before and this time it has hit me worse as I know I have nothing wrong. This is a desperate call for help. Anyone. Riot. Please. https://imgur.com/a/PKB7FbQ
I'll see if I can ask around for you.

It's a shame that they decided to leave my account gone. They put the blame on me even though they are the ones who are obliged to protect my account details. They didn't even want to double check that they are sure that it's my fault. I am disappointed more than what words can express and I am feeling helpless. Is there any advice you can give me? Or is that it.

Assuming you haven't given anyone your login details (and that's the working assumption here), there is something you can try. If I'm not mistaken, the most likely cause of a compromise would be that someone gained access to the account by using keyloggers or a virus/malware etc program inserted onto a computer that you've used the account on. Considering that, I'd certainly recommend you run a full scan on any personal/family computers you use with whatever antivirus program(s) is/are installed, and I would also recommend downloading Malwarebytes, as that seems to find certain stuff that other antivirus programs miss. I would also recommend the same for any friends/associated computers you've used.

As for any public computers you use, it's simply a case of "checking" them before you use them. Doing simple things like opening Task Manager (for windows, or equivalents for other OS) to check for any programs/processes/services that shouldn't be running and/or are suspicious and checking all the connected devices (particularly keyboards) for anything that shouldn't be there (such as a keylogger device), assuming the connection points are accessible, would help prevent any compromise. If you do happen to find something, it's best to inform whoever owns/maintains the computer so they can take action and ensure the security of the computer and customers details is maintained.
I ran a full computer scan and nothing was found, I'm at a loss.
I downloaded MalwareBytes and I found out I had 3 Registry Key Viruses. Bingo. You found it for me, Is it too late for me to tell riot this? Or is there still a small chance I can get my account back

Sometimes support miss some particular evidence of compromise, or feel it falls under account sharing. In both cases the account stays banned, but for the former (or if the latter is misidentified) you *should* get it back assuming there's no info we're missing here on boards (like multiple compromises, more than one person with persistent access to the account etc). You've given me no particular reason to doubt what you've said, but I don't like to speak in absolutes because people *do* lie on boards. I've asked someone to take a second look for you but you'll have to hang tight :)

Viruses, common passwords and hacked emails are (seemingly at least) the most often culprits for losing your login info to a malicious party, so they're definitely things to keep an eye on, especially when there is money involved. Just remember that this lesson doesn't only apply to your League account. If you suspect it was in fact a keylogger virus, now it's removed you should change any passwords that are important like bank passwords and the like. They can be a lot worse to lose than a League account.

You have no idea how thankful I am for you doing this, whether or not I get it back I'm just so so so grateful for your help. Will I be notified via email if I do get it back?  Also, I have already begun changing passwords for accounts and enabling 2FA for the ones I can as well.

Again, I am so so thankful for your help.
Ticket number would be helpful. Any response you'll get will be through those tickets I imagine.
You mean the tickets that I already made?

Yeah, that or the summ name you made the tickets with since I'm not sure it's this account you're posting on that's been banned? Just makes it easier to find the tickets really. Ticket numbers would be best.
This is the account that got banned. I am still waiting on a response on all my tickets and I am checking my email every couple of hours. Thanks again for helping, I appreciate it.
My account is now unbanned thanks to you. Add me and I'll send you a gift of your choice. Thank you.

It's a work in progress. I don't know the details only that it's still being looked into, but I do know they have to do this sort of in their spare time and on top of all their other work so it's not exactly fast sorry.
I am so thankful for your effort in getting my account unbanned. I honestly have so much respect for you and Riot. Thank you so much.
Aha I don't need a gift man, just glad it all got worked out :) Really you should be thanking Gehirn, he did all the hard work :P
